contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | name = Ornithorhynchidae | image = Platypus.jpg | image_width = 250px | image_caption = [[Platypus]] | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | classis = [[Mammal]]ia | ordo = [[Monotreme|Monotremata]] | subordo = [[Platypoda]] | familia = '''Ornithorhynchidae''' | familia_authority = [[John Edward Gray|Gray]], 1825 | subdivision_ranks = Genera | subdivision = [[extinction|†]]''[[Obdurodon]]''<br/> ''[[Ornithorhynchus]]'' }} The '''Ornithorhynchidae''' are one of the two extant families in the order [[Monotreme|Monotremata]], and contains the [[platypus]] and its extinct relatives. The other family is the Tachyglossidae, or [[echidna]]s. Within Ornithorhynchidae are two [[genus|genera]], ''[[Obdurodon]]'' and ''[[Ornithorhynchus]]'': *Family Ornithorhynchidae **Genus †''[[Obdurodon]]'' — an ancient branch of the platypus family ***†''[[Obdurodon dicksoni]]'' ***†''[[Obdurodon insignis]]'' ***†''[[Obdurodon sudamericanum|Obdurodon/Monotrematum sudamericanum]]'' **Genus ''[[Platypus|Ornithorhynchus]]'' ***''[[Ornithorhynchus anatinus]]'' (the modern [[platypus]]) Another two genera, ''[[Steropodon]]'' and ''[[Teinolophos]]'', may also belong to Ornithorhynchidae. However, they are both very ancient, and scientific literature seems to indicate they are closely related to, but not a part of, the Ornithorhynchids. The extinct ''Ornithorhynchus maximus'' was once included in ''Ornithorhynchus'', but has now been concluded to be from the echidna family as ''[[Zaglossus robustus]]''.{{cn|date=September 2012}} ==References == {{commonscat-inline|Ornithorhynchidae}} * {{MSW3 Groves|pages=p. 2}} {{Monotremata}} [[Category:Monotremes]]
